text.0: sing with oblation praise to him who maketh glad who with Ṛjiśvan drove the dusky brood away.
text.1: fain for help him the strong whose right hand wields the bolt him girt by maruts we invoke to be our friend.
text.2: indra who with triumphant wrath smote vyaṁsa down and Śambara and pipru the unrighteous one.
text.3: who extirpated Śuṣṇa the insatiatehim girt by maruts we invoke to be our friend.
text.4: he whose great work of manly might is heaven and earth and varuṇa and sūrya keep his holy law.
text.5: indra whose law the rivers follow as they flowhim girt by maruts we invoke to be our friend.
text.6: he who is lord and master of the steeds and kine honouredthe firm and sureat every holy act.
text.7: stayer even of the strong who pours no offering outhim girt by maruts we invoke to be our friend.
text.8: he who is lord of all the world that moves and breathes who for the brahman first before all found the cows.
text.9: indra who cast the dasyus down beneath his feethim girt by maruts we invoke to be our friend.
text.10: whom cowards must invoke and valiant men of war invoked by those who conquer and by those who flee.
text.11: indra to whom all beings turn their constant thoughthim girt by maruts we invoke to be our friend.
text.12: refulgent in the rudras region he proceeds and with the rudras through the wide space speeds the dame.
text.13: the hymn of praise extols indra the farrenowned him girt by maruts we invoke to be our friend.
text.14: o girt by maruts whether thou delight thee in loftiest gatheringplace or lowly dwelling.
text.15: come thence unto our rite true boonbestower through love of thee have we prepared oblations.
text.16: we fain for thee strong indra have pressed soma and o thou sought with prayer have made oblations.
text.17: now at this sacrifice with all thy maruts on sacred grass o teamborne god rejoice thee.
text.18: rejoice thee with thine own bay steeds o indra unclose thy jaws and let thy lips be open.
text.19: thou with the fair cheek let thy bay steeds bring thee gracious to us he pleased with our oblation.
text.20: guards of the camp whose praisers are the maruts may we through indra get ourselves the booty.
text.21: this prayer of ours may varuṇa grant and mitra and aditi and sindhu earth and heaven.
